data
Class HouseData

java.lang.Object
  data.HouseData

public class HouseData
extends java.lang.Object

Objects of this class provide the information contained within the database for one house. Static methods of this class provide useful algorithms involving data from all houses.

houseName

public final java.lang.String houseName
Constructor Detail

HouseData

public HouseData(java.lang.String houseName)
Loads the data from a given house and creates a HouseData object containing it.

Parameters:
houseName - Name of the house to load. The data files must be located under the inputDataDir folder, see the 'README.txt' file.
Method Detail

sensorList

public java.lang.Integer[] sensorList()
Returns an array with the sensor IDs present in the data for this house. The sensors are returned in the order implicitly assumed throughout the methods of this class.

Returns:
An array with the sensor IDs present in the data for this house.

activityList

public java.lang.Integer[] activityList()
Returns an array with the activity IDs present in the data for this house. The activity are returned in the order implicitly assumed throughout the methods of this class.

Returns:
An array with the activity IDs present in the data for this house.

sensorData

public DataPoint[] sensorData(int mappingLevel)
Returns the raw sensor data stored for this house. No sensor IDs will be shared across houses.

Parameters:
mappingLevel - Number of sensor mapping levels to apply. MAPPING_LEVEL_* constants can be used for convenience.
Returns:
An array of data point objects.

activityData

public DataPoint[] activityData(int mappingLevel)
Returns the raw activity data stored for this house.

Parameters:
mappingLevel - Number of activity mapping levels to apply. MAPPING_LEVEL_* constants can be used for convenience.
Returns:
An array of data point objects.

sensorClusters

public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>[] sensorClusters(int mappingLevel)
Returns an array of lists where each list contains the IDs of sensors present in one group after mapping.

Parameters:
mappingLevel - Number of sensor mapping levels to apply. MAPPING_LEVEL_* constants can be used for convenience.
Returns:
An array of lists where each list contains the IDs of sensors present in one group after mapping.

formatLena

public void formatLena(java.lang.String outputDirName,
                       int mappingLevelSensors,
                       int mappingLevelActivities)
Creates the necessary files in the correct format to use the data within the current house as an input for Lena's pipeline. This method will create a new folder containing all files.

Parameters:
mappingLevelSensors - Number of sensor mapping levels to apply. MAPPING_LEVEL_* constants can be used for convenience.
mappingLevelActivities - Number of activity mapping levels to apply. MAPPING_LEVEL_* constants can be used for convenience.

profileSensor

public float[][] profileSensor(int ID,
                               int blockSizeStart,
                               int blockNumLength,
                               int maxLength)
Returns a normalized histogram of sensor activations over start times and firing lengths.

Parameters:
ID - Sensor ID whose profile will be calculated.
blockSizeStart - Length of the blocks in which a day will be divided, in seconds.
blockNumLength - Number of discrete blocks into which firing lengths will be mapped.
maxLength - Maximum informative firing length. Lengths above this value will simply be regarded as being this value.
Returns:
A matrix of sensor activations over start times (first index) and firing lengths (second index).

profileSensor

public NormalDistribution profileSensor(int ID)
Returns a representation of a sensor modeled as a normal distribution over the activation times and durations of the firings of the sensor.

Parameters:
ID - Sensor ID whose profile will be calculated.
Returns:
A normal distribution representing the sensor.

profileRelational

public NormalDistribution profileRelational(int sensorA,
                                            int sensorB)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the relational profile between two sensors, modeled as a normal distribution of the differences of their firing times.

Parameters:
sensorA - First sensor ID.
sensorB - Second sensor ID.
Returns:
The relative profile between two sensors, modeled as a normal distribution of the differences of their firing times.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

profileAlphaBeta

public int[][] profileAlphaBeta(int beta)
This method calculates a matrix profile whose elements represent the number of times the second (indexed) sensor fired within beta seconds of the first (indexed) sensor. The output of this method is suitable for feeding the alpha-beta meta-feature extraction algorithm. The value -1 is output for those elements which cannot be calculated.

Parameters:
beta - Beta parameter, expressed in seconds.
Returns:
A matrix of integers. The sensors are indexed in the same order as returned from sensorList().

public static java.lang.Integer[] activityListAll(int mappingLevel)
Returns an array with the activity IDs present in the data for all houses.

Parameters:
mappingLevel - Number of activity mapping levels to apply. MAPPING_LEVEL_* constants can be used for convenience.
Returns:

mapSensors

public static void mapSensors(java.lang.String sensorNameSource,
                              java.lang.String sensorNameTarget)
Maps one sensor into another, so that the source sensor is from that moment on regarded as being the target sensor. The mapping cannot be undone.

Parameters:
sensorNameSource - Name of the source sensor that will disappear.
sensorNameTarget - Name of the target sensor that will be augmented. It will be created if it does not exist.

mapActivities

public static void mapActivities(java.lang.String activityNameSource,
                                 java.lang.String activityNameTarget)
Maps one activity into another, so that the source activity is from that moment on regarded as being the target activity. The mapping cannot be undone.

Parameters:
activityNameSource - Name of the source activity that will disappear.
activityNameTarget - Name of the target activity that will be augmented. It will be created if it does not exist.

getAllActivities

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllActivities()
Returns a list containing the names of all known activities across houses.

Returns:
A list containing the names of all known activities across houses.

sensorFiringFrequency

public static int sensorFiringFrequency(int ID)
Returns the absolute firing frequency of a given sensor.

Parameters:
ID - The ID of the sensor.
Returns:
The absolute firing frequency of the sensor.
